commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Just one more week until the Summer Festival!

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: The town's been getting more and more in the festival spirit. I'm so excited that I find myself practically running everywhere.

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: Yeah, and you almost tripped this morning because of that.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: The happi Ruby and the others designed is incredible, too!

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: *Giggle* Thank you! I can't wait to see everyone in it.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: No more black magic cape.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Yeah, now we have a wholesome design, zura.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Urgh... I only compromised because I had no choice. Be grateful for Yohane's magnanimity!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I always get a strange feeling before something fun happens. It's exciting, but a little scary, too.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: It seems like my voltage might burn! It's the something before the storm!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: The calm. The calm before the storm. You used it wrong, by the way.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Speaking of storms... Did everyone see the weather?

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: The typhoon? The projected path doesn't come near us, but I'm still a little worried.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: It might not rain, but it will probably be very windy.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Rain on a field trip, a cold before a school outing... Will the heavens curse Yohane yet again?

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Yoshiko, don't say that. Saying it out loud will jinx it.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Everyone, calm down! The typhoon is concerning, but we can't stop prep! We have to do all we can.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Right. Worrying won't get us anywhere.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Well then, let's check the schedule for the day of the Summer Festival.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: It starts at 10 am on Saturday. After an opening speech from the Festival Committee president, all other events, including the stage events, will begin.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: There's gonna be a dance, taiko drum performance, and talk show, right?

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Lots of food carts too, zura!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Our job is to oversee the Bon dance contest and the food cart sales, help at the main tent, and broadcast the tourist guide. Have we finished that yet?

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Yes! After lots of adjustments, we finally came up with something to be proud of, zura.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: I'm still practicing the script. I'll do my best introducing Numazu to everyone at the festival!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: We're counting on you. We are also to perform our own choreographed Bon dance.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: That's not a problem at the moment. We finished the choreography, and lots of people came to the dance lesson.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: The video hits are steadily climbing, too. We made an eccellente Bon dance, thanks to you.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I'm glad I could be of some help.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Eccellente? What's that?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Excellent in Italian. You should understand that much.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: We will be selling original food dishes at the food area. How is that coming along?

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Swell! We've got ingredients and equipment ready. We've gone through all the necessary formalities too.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Oh yeah, Yoshiko's takoyaki was actually way better than I imagined, zura.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: It's a flavor safe for humans.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Hmph, but of course. Creating a flavor pleasantly stimulating for a human's tongue is no trouble for Yohane.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: It took a while for you to drop the habanero flavor though.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Please forget about that.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: There will be a mikoshi shrine procession and a shagiri competition on the main shopping street in front of the station.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: A mikoshi shrine! That really makes a festival!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: I want to try carrying the mikoshi shrine, too! Don't the gods ride inside the mikoshi? I might be able to see a god if I get close enough!

commands.speaker: Riko
commands.line: I don't think gods are that easily seen.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What's a shagiri?

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Shagiri is like accompaniment music to traditional performances, zura. It gets really exciting with all the gongs and taiko drums.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: The festival spans larger than the places I just mentioned. Please read the schedules I handed out for the details.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: As for our live show, we'll be performing on Sunday at 6:30 pm on a special stage.

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: 6:30 pm... That makes it the finale of the festival. That's a little nerve-racking.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: It's too late to say that! It's an honor to be the final act of the festival. Hold your head high during our performance!

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Yeah, the song is almost done, too. I can't wait for lots of people to hear it. Right, Chika?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: What?! Y-Yeah!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Chika?)

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: A video of the festival will be made. We were asked to take a few photos.

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: I was hoping to ask you to be in charge of it. Will you help us with that?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: M-Me?! Are you sure?

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Why not? You might be able to snap things from a different perspective, not being from Numazu and all.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Okay. Leave it to me!

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Thank you.

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Take some good pictures, please.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Sure!
